verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Standard opening for a new section of laws.

verses.text: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, 'I am the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Typical identification formula, asserting God's authority.

verses.text: You shall not do as they do in the land of Egypt, where you lived, and you shall not do as they do in the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you. Do not walk in their statutes.
verses.comment: Emphasizes separation from pagan customs.

verses.text: You must follow my rules and keep my statutes and walk in them; I am the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Affirms the source of law as God, not human culture.

verses.text: Therefore you shall keep my statutes and my rules; a person who does them shall live by them. I am the LORD.
verses.comment: Centrality of law-keeping for life; cited in the NT.

verses.text: None of you shall approach any close relative to uncover their nakedness. I am the LORD.
verses.comment: "Uncover nakedness" is an idiom for sexual relations.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father, that is, the nakedness of your mother. She is your mother; you shall not uncover her nakedness.
verses.comment: "Nakedness of your father" means sexual relations with the mother.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's wife; it is your father's nakedness.
verses.comment: Includes step-mothers.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home or born abroad.
verses.comment: Covers both full and half-sisters.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your son's daughter or your daughter's daughter, for their nakedness is your own.
verses.comment: Forbids sexual relations with grandchildren.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of the daughter of your father's wife, brought up in your father's family, as she is your sister.
verses.comment: Step-sisters included as family.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's sister; she is your father's near relative.
verses.comment: Aunt on the father's side.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother's sister, for she is your mother's near relative.
verses.comment: Aunt on the mother's side.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's brother; you shall not approach his wife. She is your aunt.
verses.comment: Prohibits relations with uncle's wife (aunt by marriage).

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law; she is your son's wife. You shall not uncover her nakedness.
verses.comment: Prohibits sexual relations with daughter-in-law.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother's wife; it is your brother's nakedness.
verses.comment: Exception exists for levirate marriage (see Deut. 25:5).

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter. You shall not take her son's daughter or her daughter's daughter to uncover her nakedness; they are her close relatives. It is depravity.
verses.comment: Prohibits marrying both a woman and her descendants.

verses.text: And you shall not take a woman as a rival wife to her sister, to uncover her nakedness while the sister is still alive.
verses.comment: Prevents marrying sisters as rival wives simultaneously.

verses.text: You shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness while she is in her menstrual uncleanness.
verses.comment: Prohibits sexual relations during menstruation.

verses.text: You shall not lie sexually with your neighbor's wife and thus make yourself unclean with her.
verses.comment: Prohibits adultery.

verses.text: You shall not give any of your children to offer them to Molech, and so profane the name of your God. I am the LORD.
verses.comment: Refers to child sacrifice to the false god Molech.

verses.text: You shall not lie with a male as with a woman; it is an abomination.
verses.comment: Explicit prohibition of male homosexual acts.

verses.text: And you shall not lie with any animal to make yourself unclean with it, neither shall any woman give herself to an animal to lie with it; it is perversion.
verses.comment: Prohibits bestiality for both men and women.

verses.text: Do not make yourselves unclean by any of these things, for by all these the nations I am driving out before you have become unclean.
verses.comment: Such acts justify God driving out the Canaanites.

verses.text: And the land became unclean, so I punished its iniquity, and the land vomited out its inhabitants.
verses.comment: Personification of the land expelling sinners.

verses.text: But you shall keep my statutes and my rules and shall not do any of these abominations, either the native or the foreigner who dwells among you.
verses.comment: Uniform law for both Israelites and foreigners residing among them.

verses.text: For all these abominations the people of the land, who were before you, did, and the land became unclean.
verses.comment: Restates the reason for judgment on previous inhabitants.

verses.text: So do not let the land vomit you out for making it unclean, as it vomited out the nations that were before you.
verses.comment: Warns Israel not to repeat the nations' sins.

verses.text: For everyone who does any of these abominations, those souls who do them shall be cut off from among their people.
verses.comment: "Cut off" may mean excommunication or execution.

verses.text: So keep my charge, not to practice any of these abominable customs that were practiced before you, and do not make yourselves unclean by them. I am the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Concludes with a summary and repeated warning.
